SEARCH
Package com.serezk4.database

Class ConnectionManager

java.lang.Object
com.serezk4.database.ConnectionManager
public final class ConnectionManager extends Object
Manages the database connection and provides utility methods for preparing SQL statements.

The ConnectionManager class implements the Singleton pattern to ensure that only one instance of the connection to the database exists. It initializes the database connection using credentials and configurations provided by the DatabaseConfiguration class.

Key Features:

  • Manages a single instance of the database connection.
  • Prepares SQL statements with or without parameters for execution.
  • Ensures that the database connection is always available by re-establishing it if it is closed.

Usage:

 ConnectionManager manager = ConnectionManager.getInstance();
 PreparedStatement stmt = manager.prepare("SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = ?");
 stmt.setInt(1, userId);
 ResultSet rs = stmt.executeQuery();

  • Constructor Details

    • ConnectionManager

      private ConnectionManager()
      Initializes the database connection.

      The constructor is private to enforce the Singleton pattern. It loads the PostgreSQL JDBC driver and establishes a connection to the database using the credentials and URL from DatabaseConfiguration.

      If the driver cannot be loaded or the connection cannot be established, an error is logged, and the application exits with a status code of 1.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static ConnectionManager getInstance() throws SQLException
      Returns the singleton instance of the ConnectionManager.

      This method ensures that only one instance of the ConnectionManager exists. If the instance is null or the current connection is closed, a new instance is created.

      Thread Safety:

      This method is not thread-safe. If multiple threads access this method simultaneously, it may result in multiple instances being created. Use synchronization or other mechanisms if thread safety is required.

      Returns:
      the singleton instance of the ConnectionManager.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs while checking the connection state or creating a new instance.

    • prepare

    • prepare

      public PreparedStatement prepare(String query, Object... parameters) throws SQLException
      Prepares a SQL statement with parameters for execution.

      This method creates a PreparedStatement for the provided SQL query and sets the specified parameters in the statement.

      Workflow:

      • Creates a PreparedStatement using the prepare(String) method.
      • Iterates through the provided parameters and sets them in the statement using setObject.

      Example:

       PreparedStatement stmt = manager.prepare(
     "INSERT INTO users (name, age) VALUES (?, ?)", "John Doe", 30
 );
 stmt.executeUpdate();
      Parameters:
      query - the SQL query to prepare.
      parameters - the parameters to set in the prepared statement.
      Returns:
      a PreparedStatement object with the given query and parameters set.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs while preparing the statement or setting parameters.
